DataElement.preferredName: Person Cutaneous T-Cell Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma Skin Painful Hand Foot Crack Psychometrics Assessment Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Response on a psychometric measure documenting how often a human being experiences painful cracks on the hands or feet due to CTCL (Cutaneous T-Cell Lymphoma) in the skin. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Cutaneous T-Cell Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma Skin Painful Hand Foot Crack
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A single human being._A T-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma arising from the skin. Representative examples include mycosis fungoides and primary cutaneous anaplastic large cell lymphoma._An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body.  It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages._Causing physical or psychological misery, pain or distress._The distal portion of the upper extremity.  It consists of the carpus, metacarpus, and digits._The structure found below the ankle joint required for locomotion._A break or fissure in a structure.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Person Cutaneous T-Cell Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma Skin
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being.:A T-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma arising from the skin. Representative examples include mycosis fungoides and primary cutaneous anaplastic large cell lymphoma.:1. An organ and the enveloping membrane of the body; includes, in addition to the epidermis and dermis, all of the derivatives of the epidermis, e.g., hairs, nails, sudoriferous and sebaceous glands, and mammary glands. Subdivisions of the skin surround various body parts; as a whole, the skin constitutes the external surface of the body. 2. The rind, capsule, or covering of any body or part.

Concepts.definition: A T-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma arising from the skin. Representative examples include mycosis fungoides and primary cutaneous anaplastic large cell lymphoma.
An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

Property.preferredDefinition: Causing physical or psychological misery, pain or distress.:The distal portion of the upper extremity. It consists of the carpus, metacarpus, and digits. :The terminal part of the lower extremity, especially the part below the ankle.:A break or fissure in a structure.

Concepts.definition: Causing physical or psychological misery, pain or distress.
The distal portion of the upper extremity. It consists of the carpus, metacarpus, and digits.
The structure found below the ankle joint.
A break or fissure in a structure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The science of measuring "psychological" aspects of a person such as knowledge, skills, abilities, or personality.
